data.text:
Neil Patrick Harris: career and life achievements

He began his career as a child actor and appeared in the 1988 novel, drama film adaptation Clara’s Heart in the character of Whoopi Goldberg. He made his first acting role as an adult in 1995’s Animal Room in his teens. Since then he has been actively working in dramas, movies and plays. His worked movies include 2000 ‘The Next Best Thing’, 2004 ‘Harold & Kumar Go to White Castle’, 2011 ‘Beastly’, 2012 ‘American Reunion’, 2019 ‘Dads’ and 2021 ‘Matrix’, among many others.

Since 1988, he has been working on television, first appearing as Danny Harland on Too Good to Be True. His television movies, dramas and series credits 1991 ‘Blossom’, 1992 ‘Roseanne’, 1995 ‘Not Our Son’, 1999 ‘Stark Raving Mad’, 2002 ‘Justice League’, 2003 ‘Spider-Man: The New Animated Series ‘ and 2015 ‘Best Time Ever with Neil Patrick Harris’, many more.

Additionally, it has hosted several awards including the Tony Awards in 2009-2013. He also hosted the Primetime Emmy Awards in 2009 and 2013 and hosted the 87th Academy Awards in 2015. In addition, Harris was named to Time magazine’s 100 Most Influential People list in 2010.
